examples.title: European Immigration to America
examples.description: When people from Europe moved to America from the 1600s to 1900s, they brought languages, religions,  and faiths. And by this formed new communities.

examples.title: Spread of Buddhism
examples.description: Buddhist missionaries from India traveled to China, Japan, Southeast Asia, etc. They bring Buddhist beliefs and practices that later were adapted.

examples.title: Fashion Trends
examples.description: New fashion styles are beginning  in big cities like Paris or New York. Then through celebrities it spreads to smaller cities.

examples.title: Technology Adoption
examples.description: New technologies like smartphones, watches, laptops, are first used by tech-savvy people in cities. Then it becomes usual for other populations.

examples.title: Fast Food Adaptations
examples.description: McDonald’s changes the menu in different countries. For example teriyaki burgers in Japan, paneer wraps in India. But keep the same concept.

examples.title: Religious Syncretism
examples.description: When Christianity spread to Latin America, it mixed with local beliefs and created new traditions. For example Santeria in Cuba or Vodou in Haiti.

examples.title: Social Media Trends
examples.description: Memes spread quickly, moving from person to person online regardless of who they are. Or also spread offline.

examples.title: Language Slang
examples.description: New slang can spread through conversation with friends, classmates, coworkers. And they doesn’t have to be the most influential.
